Minnesota's Somali community stands up to Trump: 'We are no less American than other Americans'
Subhead: After the revelation of a Covid-19 relief fraud scheme involving nearly 80 individuals of Somali origin, the American president deployed immigration police within the large Somali community in Minnesota, whose members are predominantly US citizens.

Rob Reiner's son charged with two counts of first-degree murder, could face death penalty if convicted
Subhead: Nick Reiner was taken into police custody on Monday, the day after the bodies of his parents were discovered in their Los Angeles home. He is being held without bail. 'These charges carry a maximum sentence of life in prison without the possibility of parole or the death penalty,' LA District Attorney Nathan Hochman said on Tuesday.

Title: Inside one of New York's 'community kitchens', at the forefront of the cost-of-living crisis in the United States
Subhead: In the world's largest economy, where consumer prices – including food – have soared since the Covid-19 pandemic, 41 million people rely on government-issued food stamps to eat enough every day.

Title: Morocco: Images of the flooding in Safi that has left 37 dead on the Atlantic coast
Subhead: Flash flooding in Safi, on Morocco's Atlantic coast, killed 37 people on Sunday. This is the highest death toll from such weather events in the country over the past decade.

Title: 'Academic freedom at risk': The Danish university shaken by an anti-immigration cabal
Subhead: Roskilde University found itself at the center of controversy over its programs, which were accused by both the far right and Social Democratic Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen of being a backdoor route to immigration for foreign students.

'It is easier to flatter the people than to serve. Therein lies the last obstacle to an RN victory in 2027'
Subhead: Populism has never been stronger in France, but there is a crucial difference between flattering the people and serving them, and the Rassemblement National is currently stumbling on that divide, writes Le Monde columnist Françoise Fressoz.

Title: 'Zack Polanski effect' has UK Greens closing gap on Labour
Subhead: The unconventional profile of the new leader of Britain's Green Party, who embraces 'eco-populism' and has made social justice a central focus, has allowed his historically marginal party to claim the political space to the left of Labour.

Title: The rivalry between France and Italy, as seen by Meloni
Subhead: The Italian prime minister uses France's current difficulties in her speeches to highlight the successes of her own policies, positioning herself as a model for a segment of France's far right.
